Package gameWorld

Class HitBox

java.lang.Object
gameWorld.HitBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class HitBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
A HitBox, is a Rectangle that moves with the GameObject that's affected to it.

To check what a GameObject is please refer to GameObject.

See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    HitBox​(Vector2 size, GameObject objet)
    Constructs a new HitBox, whose GameObject is specified by the GameObject argument.

      Constructs a new HitBox, whose GameObject is specified by the GameObject argument.

    • collide

      public boolean collide​(HitBox h)
      Checks if the HitBox is colliding with an other HitBox.
      Parameters:
      h - the other HitBox
      Returns:
      true if it's colliding, false otherwise.

    • collide

      public boolean collide​(Vector2 objectsPosition, HitBox h)
      Checks if the HitBox is colliding with an another HitBox at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      h - the other HitBox
      objectsPosition - the position of the other HitBox
      Returns:
      true if it's colliding, false otherwise.

      true if it's colliding, false otherwise.
